items.title: What to know as Trump, world leaders sign Gaza peace plan and discuss next steps
items.standfirst: President Trump is heading back to the U.S. after his whirlwind trip to the Middle East, where he celebrated the first phase of a peace plan between Israel and Hamas. CBS News' Debora Patta and Nancy Cordes report.

items.title: Trump, world leaders sign Gaza peace deal after Hamas frees all living hostages

items.content: President Trump got a standing ovation after addressing Israeli lawmakers following Hamas' release of all living hostages under the Gaza peace deal.

items.title: Trump sets sights on peace with Iran as he hails ‘end of Gaza war’
items.standfirst: In speech to Israeli Knesset hours after hostages released, US president spoke of ‘historic dawn of new Middle East’Gaza ceasefire – live updatesDonald Trump vowed on Monday to use the power of his presidency to ensure that Israel recognises it has achieved “all that it can by force of arms”, and begin an age of cooperation in the Middle East that may ultimately extend as far as peace with Iran.In a speech to the Israeli Knesset, made hours after the last remaining Israeli hostages were released from Gaza, Trump hailed the “historic dawn of a new Middle East” and an end to the “long and painful nightmare” of the Gaza war. Continue reading...
items.content: In speech to Israeli Knesset hours after hostages released, US president spoke of ‘historic dawn of new Middle East’Gaza ceasefire – live updatesDonald Trump vowed on Monday to use the power of his presidency to ensure that Israel recognises it has achieved “all that it can by force of arms”, and begin an age of cooperation in the Middle East that may ultimately extend as far as peace with Iran.In a speech to the Israeli Knesset, made hours after the last remaining Israeli hostages were released from Gaza, Trump hailed the “historic dawn of a new Middle East” and an end to the “long and painful nightmare” of the Gaza war. Continue reading...

Following Mr. Trump's remarks, CBS News' Robert Berger, Nancy Cordes, Elizabeth Palmer and Courtney Kealy offered analysis.

items.title: 'Prayers of millions have finally been answered': Trump praises peace deal
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump praised the signing of a peace agreement ending two years of fighting between Israel and Hamas in Gaza, saying "nobody thought it could happen." The peace deal was signed after all remaining living hostages held by Hamas were returned to Israel.

items.title: Israeli hostage families reflect as loved ones come home
items.standfirst: Hamas has released all 20 of the remaining living Israeli hostages, who are now being reunited with their families in Israel, as part of President Trump's peace plan to end the war in Gaza. "CBS Mornings" co-host Tony Dokoupil spoke with families ahead of the return of their loved ones.

items.title: All living Israeli hostages released by Hamas, Israel releases Palestinian prisoners
items.standfirst: Hamas released all living Israeli hostages on Monday, and Israel began releasing Palestinian prisoners. Also, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and President Trump addressed the Knesset. CBS News Nancy Cordes and Debora Patta have more details, while Former U.S. Ambassador to Israel Edward Djerejian breaks down the peace deal.
items.content: Hamas released all living Israeli hostages on Monday, and Israel began releasing Palestinian prisoners. Also, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and President Trump addressed the Knesset. CBS News Nancy Cordes and Debora Patta have more details, while Former U.S. Ambassador to Israel Edward Djerejian breaks down the peace deal.

items.title: Donald Trump praises role played by Egyptian President in Gaza deal
items.standfirst: Trump praised Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi's on October 13, 2025 as the two leaders appeared together before an international summit on the Gaza deal. "He played a very important role" in talks with Hamas. "I appreciate it very much," Trump said of Sisi, whom he called as a powerful leader who keeps crime down in his country.
items.content: Trump praised Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi's on October 13, 2025 as the two leaders appeared together before an international summit on the Gaza deal. "He played a very important role" in talks with Hamas. "I appreciate it very much," Trump said of Sisi, whom he called as a powerful leader who keeps crime down in his country.

items.title: Trump’s speech: “The long and painful nightmare is over”
items.standfirst: US Donald Trump told the Israeli parliament on Monday that the Gaza ceasefire deal he helped broker marked a "historic dawn of a new Middle East". Trump arrived in Israel as Hamas liberated all 20 living Israeli hostages and several Palestinian prisoners were released from Israeli jails under the first phase of the truce plan.
items.content: US Donald Trump told the Israeli parliament on Monday that the Gaza ceasefire deal he helped broker marked a "historic dawn of a new Middle East". Trump arrived in Israel as Hamas liberated all 20 living Israeli hostages and several Palestinian prisoners were released from Israeli jails under the first phase of the truce plan.

items.title: 'Long and painful nightmare finally over,' Trump tells Israel's parliament
items.standfirst: The US president was applauded by Israeli lawmakers for his role in brokering an Israel-Hamas ceasefire.
items.content: The US president was applauded by Israeli lawmakers for his role in brokering an Israel-Hamas ceasefire.

items.title: Leaders gather around Donald Trump in Sharm El-Sheikh for Middle East peace summit
items.standfirst: World leaders, led by President Donald Trump and Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi, gathered in Sharm El-Sheikh for a crucial Middle East peace summit. The meeting aims to build on the recent US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Hamas and pave the way for lasting stability in the region. FRANCE 24's journalist analyse Trump's speech and the stakes of the summit.
items.content: World leaders, led by President Donald Trump and Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi, gathered in Sharm El-Sheikh for a crucial Middle East peace summit. The meeting aims to build on the recent US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Hamas and pave the way for lasting stability in the region. FRANCE 24's journalist analyse Trump's speech and the stakes of the summit.

items.title: Trump hails "historic dawn of a new Middle East" in speech to Knesset
items.standfirst: President Trump addressed the Israeli parliament after the hostages were reunited with their families.
items.content: President Trump addressed the Israeli parliament after the hostages were reunited with their families.

items.title: Worlds leaders gather in Egypt to back Gaza ceasefire plan
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump arrived in Egypt Monday for a global summit on Gaza’s future, following his visit to Israel to mark a US-brokered ceasefire with Hamas. His trip, including a speech at the Knesset in Jerusalem, comes amid hopes to end two years of conflict between Israel and Hamas. Over two dozen countries will attend the summit hosted by Trump and Egypt’s President el-Sissi. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu declined, citing a nearby Jewish holiday.
items.content: President Donald Trump arrived in Egypt Monday for a global summit on Gaza’s future, following his visit to Israel to mark a US-brokered ceasefire with Hamas. His trip, including a speech at the Knesset in Jerusalem, comes amid hopes to end two years of conflict between Israel and Hamas. Over two dozen countries will attend the summit hosted by Trump and Egypt’s President el-Sissi. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu declined, citing a nearby Jewish holiday.

items.title: Palestinians celebrate as prisoners are released by Israel under Gaza ceasefire deal
items.standfirst: Among the 2,000 Palestinians freed in the Gaza ceasefire deal were 250 serving life terms for attacks on Israelis dating back decades.
items.content: Among the 2,000 Palestinians freed in the Gaza ceasefire deal were 250 serving life terms for attacks on Israelis dating back decades.(Image credit: Majdi Mohammed)

items.title: Israeli hostages return home after two years in captivity
items.standfirst: The 20 remaining living Israeli hostages held in Gaza have now been reunited with their families, after Hamas released them as part of the ceasefire deal. The bodies of 28 hostages killed in Gaza are also set to be returned to their families.
items.content: The 20 remaining living Israeli hostages held in Gaza have now been reunited with their families, after Hamas released them as part of the ceasefire deal. The bodies of 28 hostages killed in Gaza are also set to be returned to their families.

items.title: Hamas releases all living hostages and Israel frees prisoners under Gaza deal
items.standfirst: Ramallah in the West Bank and Tel Aviv in Israel are filled with families gathered for the return of their loved ones. With around 20 Israeli hostages released and nearly 1,900 Palestinian prisoners freed, the end of the war has stirred deep emotions on both sides, as our reporters reveal.
items.content: Ramallah in the West Bank and Tel Aviv in Israel are filled with families gathered for the return of their loved ones. With around 20 Israeli hostages released and nearly 1,900 Palestinian prisoners freed, the end of the war has stirred deep emotions on both sides, as our reporters reveal.

items.title: Palestinians welcome released prisoners as part of Gaza ceasefire agreement
items.standfirst: Cheers erupted in Ramallah, West Bank, as Israel released nearly 2,000 prisoners under the Gaza ceasefire deal in exchange for Israeli hostages freed by Hamas. Freed prisoners were warmly welcomed by crowds, but celebrations remained restrained due to restrictions imposed by nearby Israeli settlers, as FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin details from the crowd.
items.content: Cheers erupted in Ramallah, West Bank, as Israel released nearly 2,000 prisoners under the Gaza ceasefire deal in exchange for Israeli hostages freed by Hamas. Freed prisoners were warmly welcomed by crowds, but celebrations remained restrained due to restrictions imposed by nearby Israeli settlers, as FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin details from the crowd.

items.title: Main takeaways of Trump's speech to the Israeli parliament
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump hailed an end to Israel's "painful nightmare" in a speech to the Israeli knesset on Monday as the last surviving hostages returned from Gaza and the first Palestinian prisoners were freed under a US-brokered ceasefire. His lightning visit came ahead of a Gaza peace summit in Egypt's Sharm El-Sheikh.
items.content: US President Donald Trump hailed an end to Israel's "painful nightmare" in a speech to the Israeli knesset on Monday as the last surviving hostages returned from Gaza and the first Palestinian prisoners were freed under a US-brokered ceasefire. His lightning visit came ahead of a Gaza peace summit in Egypt's Sharm El-Sheikh.

items.title: After Israel, Trump arrives in Egypt's Sharm El-Sheikh for summit on Gaza’s future
In West Bank, Palestinian prisoners come home under celebration ban
items.standfirst: Over 1,900 Palestinians have been freed as part of the Gaza peace deal on October 13, but strict conditions in the West Bank imposed by Israeli prevent families from celebrating the return of loved ones, as FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin reports. She also ponders on how the Palestinians react to the peace deal agreement.
items.content: Over 1,900 Palestinians have been freed as part of the Gaza peace deal on October 13, but strict conditions in the West Bank imposed by Israeli prevent families from celebrating the return of loved ones, as FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin reports. She also ponders on how the Palestinians react to the peace deal agreement.

items.title: What's next for Israel-Hamas truce with hostage and prisoner release underway
items.standfirst: As Israeli hostages are freed and Palestinian prisoners and detainees released — and after President Donald Trump's lengthy address to Israel’s parliament on Monday — focus is shifting to what comes next.
items.content: As Israeli hostages are freed and Palestinian prisoners and detainees released — and after President Donald Trump's lengthy address to Israel’s parliament on Monday — focus is shifting to what comes next.

items.title: Palestinian prisoners return free to Ramallah as part of ceasefire deal
items.standfirst: As part of the ceasefire deal Israel agreed to release more than 1,900 Palestinian prisoners. The green light came only after Israel confirmed that Hamas had freed all of the 20 remaining living and dead hostages. However, the list does not include the around half a dozen highest profile prisoners - including Marwan Barhghouti, who's seen as the Palestinian Nelson Mandela and is widely viewed as a possible future president of Palestine.
items.content: As part of the ceasefire deal Israel agreed to release more than 1,900 Palestinian prisoners. The green light came only after Israel confirmed that Hamas had freed all of the 20 remaining living and dead hostages. However, the list does not include the around half a dozen highest profile prisoners - including Marwan Barhghouti, who's seen as the Palestinian Nelson Mandela and is widely viewed as a possible future president of Palestine.

items.title: Families reunite as Gaza ceasefire brings hostages and prisoners home
items.standfirst: Twenty living hostages were released by Hamas on Monday after more than two years in captivity as the Gaza ceasefire continues to hold. Palestinian prisoners were also released by Israel under the terms of President Trump's peace plan.
items.content: Twenty living hostages were released by Hamas on Monday after more than two years in captivity as the Gaza ceasefire continues to hold. Palestinian prisoners were also released by Israel under the terms of President Trump's peace plan.

items.title: Who are the 20 hostages released by Hamas?
items.standfirst: More than two years after they were abducted during the terrorist attack that launched the Israel-Hamas war, all remaining living hostages have been returned to Israel from the Gaza Strip.
items.content: More than two years after they were abducted during the terrorist attack that launched the Israel-Hamas war, all remaining living hostages have been returned to Israel from the Gaza Strip.

items.title: In a ‘wishful thinking’ address, Donald Trump hails ‘historic dawn of a new Middle East’
items.standfirst: In a historic address at the Israeli Knesset, US President Donald Trump declared that 'the era of terror has ended', marking the dawn of a new chapter for the Middle East. Delivered on the first day of the initial phase of a landmark peace agreement with Hamas, the speech was met with unanimous applause, including from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert has the analysis as Trump imposes himself as a peacemaker in the Middle East.
items.content: In a historic address at the Israeli Knesset, US President Donald Trump declared that 'the era of terror has ended', marking the dawn of a new chapter for the Middle East. Delivered on the first day of the initial phase of a landmark peace agreement with Hamas, the speech was met with unanimous applause, including from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert has the analysis as Trump imposes himself as a peacemaker in the Middle East.

ai_summary: Trump signed a Gaza ceasefire deal after Hamas released all living Israeli hostages.
The US President addressed the Israeli Knesset after the hostage release.
Hundreds of Palestinian detainees and prisoners were also released.
Trump spoke of a "historic dawn" and potential peace with Iran.
There are ongoing criticisms of Tony Blair for his role in the Iraq war.

clusters.title: Madagascar’s President Andry Rajoelina has left the country, French radio reports
clusters.neutral_headline: Madagascar President Reportedly Flees Country Amid Protests

items.title: Madagascar’s President Andry Rajoelina has left the country, French radio reports
items.standfirst: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina left the country on Sunday evening after factions of the army rallied behind the protesters who have been staging weeks of demonstrations, FRANCE 24 sister station Radio France Internationale (RFI) reported on Monday.
items.content: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina left the country on Sunday evening after factions of the army rallied behind the protesters who have been staging weeks of demonstrations, FRANCE 24 sister station Radio France Internationale (RFI) reported on Monday.

items.title: Madagascar president flees after losing support of key army unit
items.standfirst: Elite Capsat unit that played a major role in Andry Rajoelina’s rise to presidency joined gen Z protests against corruptionMadagascar’s president, Andry Rajoelina, is reported to have fled the country on a French military aircraft, hours before he was scheduled to address the people.French state radio RFI reported on Monday that the president, who also has French citizenship, had been flown out of the capital, Antananarivo, after a deal with President Emmanuel Macron. It added that he may have headed for Dubai. Continue reading...

items.title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy ordered to go to jail next week
items.standfirst: Sarkozy must go to La Santé prison in Paris after conviction over scheme to obtain election funds from Gaddafi regimeThe former French president Nicolas Sarkozy has been ordered to go to jail in Paris next week after a court last month sentenced him to five years in prison for criminal conspiracy over a scheme to obtain election campaign funds from the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi.Sarkozy, who was the rightwing president of France between 2007 and 2012, was summoned to meet state prosecutors on Monday. They told him he must present himself at the entrance of La Santé prison in the south of Paris on 21 October to begin his sentence. Continue reading...

They told him he must present himself at the entrance of La Santé prison in the south of Paris on 21 October to begin his sentence. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Why Signal’s post-quantum makeover is an amazing engineering achievement

items.title: Why Signal’s post-quantum makeover is an amazing engineering achievement
items.standfirst: The encryption protecting communications against criminal and nation-state snooping is under threat. As private industry and governments get closer to building useful quantum computers, the algorithms protecting Bitcoin wallets, encrypted Web visits, and other sensitive secrets will be useless. No…
items.content: The encryption protecting communications against criminal and nation-state snooping is under threat. As private industry and governments get closer to building useful quantum computers, the algorithms protecting Bitcoin wallets, encrypted Web visits, and other sensitive secrets will be useless. No…

items.title: Why Signal’s post-quantum makeover is an amazing engineering achievement
items.standfirst: New design sets a high standard for post-quantum readiness.
items.content: The encryption protecting communications against criminal and nation-state snooping is under threat. As private industry and governments get closer to building useful quantum computers, the algorithms protecting Bitcoin wallets, encrypted Web visits, and other sensitive secrets will be useless. No one doubts the day will come, but as the now-common joke in cryptography circles observes, experts have been forecasting this cryptocalypse will arrive in the next 15 to 30 years for the past 30 years. The uncertainty has created something of an existential dilemma: Should network architects spend the billions of dollars required to wean themselves off quantum-vulnerable algorithms now, or should they prioritize their limited security budgets fighting more immediate threats such as ransomware and espionage attacks? Given the expense and no clear deadline, it’s little wonder that less than half of all TLS connections made inside the Cloudflare network and only 18 percent of Fortune 500 networks support quantum-resistant TLS connections. It's all but certain that many fewer organizations still are supporting quantum-ready encryption in less prominent protocols. Triumph of the cypherpunks One exception to the industry-wide lethargy is the engineering team that designs the Signal Protocol, the open-source engine that powers the world’s most robust and resilient form of end-to-end encryption for multiple private chat apps, most notably the Signal Messenger. Eleven days ago, the nonprofit entity that develops the protocol, Signal Messenger LLC, published a 5,900-word write-up describing its latest updates that make Signal fully quantum-resistant.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: Signal is updating its encryption for quantum computers.
Quantum computers threaten current encryption methods.
The new design sets a high standard for security.
The update protects against criminal and nation-state snooping.
The post-quantum makeover is an engineering achievement.
